Please keep in mind that with any upstream change, there may also be packaging changes that need to be made. bugs.title: CVE-2022-43603 OpenImageIO: denial of service vulnerability [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2022-43603 OpenImageIO: denial of service vulnerability [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2022-43603 openimageio: denial of service vulnerability

long_desc.thetext:
A denial of service vulnerability exists in the ZfileOutput::close() functionality of OpenImageIO Project OpenImageIO v2.4.4.2. A specially crafted ImageOutput Object can lead to denial of service. An attacker can provide a malicious file to trigger this vulnerability.

https://talosintelligence.com/vulnerability_reports/TALOS-2022-1657

Created OpenImageIO tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-all [bug 2156028]
Affects: fedora-all [bug 2156029]

This CVE Bugzilla entry is for community support informational purposes only as it does not affect a package in a commercially supported Red Hat product. Refer to the dependent bugs for status of those individual community products.

More information about this security flaw is available in the following bug:

http://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2156027

Disclaimer: Community trackers are created by Red Hat Product Security team on a best effort basis. Package maintainers are required to ascertain if the flaw indeed affects their package, before starting the update process.

Use the following template to for the 'fedpkg update' request to submit an
update for this issue as it contains the top-level parent bug(s) as well as
this tracking bug.  This will ensure that all associated bugs get updated
when new packages are pushed to stable.

=====

# bugfix, security, enhancement, newpackage (required)
type=security

# low, medium, high, urgent (required)
severity=medium

# testing, stable
request=testing

# Bug numbers: 1234,9876
bugs=2156027,2156029

# Description of your update
notes=Security fix for [PUT CVEs HERE]

# Enable request automation based on the stable/unstable karma thresholds
autokarma=True
stable_karma=3
unstable_karma=-3

# Automatically close bugs when this marked as stable
close_bugs=True

# Suggest that users restart after update
suggest_reboot=False

======

Additionally, you may opt to use the bodhi web interface to submit updates:

https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/new

bugs.title: CVE-2022-41981 OpenImageIO: stack-based buffer overflow vulnerability [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2022-41981 OpenImageIO: stack-based buffer overflow vulnerability [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2022-41981 openimageio: stack-based buffer overflow vulnerability

long_desc.thetext:
A stack-based buffer overflow vulnerability exists in the TGA file format parser of OpenImageIO v2.3.19.0. A specially-crafted targa file can lead to out of bounds read and write on the process stack, which can lead to arbitrary code execution. An attacker can provide a malicious file to trigger this vulnerability.

https://talosintelligence.com/vulnerability_reports/TALOS-2022-1628

Created OpenImageIO tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-all [bug 2156032]
Affects: fedora-all [bug 2156033]

This CVE Bugzilla entry is for community support informational purposes only as it does not affect a package in a commercially supported Red Hat product. Refer to the dependent bugs for status of those individual community products.

More information about this security flaw is available in the following bug:

http://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2156031

Disclaimer: Community trackers are created by Red Hat Product Security team on a best effort basis. Package maintainers are required to ascertain if the flaw indeed affects their package, before starting the update process.

Use the following template to for the 'fedpkg update' request to submit an
update for this issue as it contains the top-level parent bug(s) as well as
this tracking bug.  This will ensure that all associated bugs get updated
when new packages are pushed to stable.

=====

# bugfix, security, enhancement, newpackage (required)
type=security

# low, medium, high, urgent (required)
severity=medium

# testing, stable
request=testing

# Bug numbers: 1234,9876
bugs=2156031,2156033

# Description of your update
notes=Security fix for [PUT CVEs HERE]

# Enable request automation based on the stable/unstable karma thresholds
autokarma=True
stable_karma=3
unstable_karma=-3

# Automatically close bugs when this marked as stable
close_bugs=True

# Suggest that users restart after update
suggest_reboot=False

======

Additionally, you may opt to use the bodhi web interface to submit updates:

https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/new
